meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one millionth of a meter.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a microscope to measure tiny objects in micrometers.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician measured the cell size in micrometers using a specialized tool.
meanings.sent3: The ant thought the micrometers were too small to notice, but the scientist proved him wrong.
meanings.sent4: The precision of the micrometers revealed details invisible to the naked eye.
meanings.sent5: The concept of micrometers helped the students understand the scale of microscopic organisms.

meanings.definition: An instrument used for measuring very small distances.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used micrometers to ensure the accuracy of the machine parts.
meanings.sent2: The engineer relied on micrometers to calibrate the delicate instruments.
meanings.sent3: The micrometers had a playful rivalry with the ruler in the toolbox.
meanings.sent4: The precision of the micrometers was compared to the keen eye of a hawk.
meanings.sent5: The shiny micrometers gleamed under the bright lights of the workshop.
